pr_title: ENT-3286: Manifest delete takes 24 hours or more in large environment (60k consumers in owner)

timeline.bodyText: This method is almost identical to the one above it, and could/should call into it with a null consumer argument instead. The base findStackByIds can then gate the first line (.add(Restrictions.eq("consumer", consumer))) on the presence of consumer.
timeline.author: Ceiu

timeline.bodyText:
There are a ton of changes here which don't add much to performance or readability, don't address the core problem, but will make rebasing/merging the looming provided products change a nightmare. This particular method wasn't touched in that, but its sister method in OwnerContentCurator has, using partitionMap. That would be preferable here.
See: https://github.com/candlepin/candlepin/blob/feature/move_provided_product/server/src/main/java/org/candlepin/model/OwnerContentCurator.java#L532
timeline.author: Ceiu

replies.bodyText: This change was not related to performance. This is the place where manifest import fails with too many params. I did some renaming to better see what is happening with all those reassignments. I can revert those to to prevent conflicts but partitioning needs to stay otherwise import will fail.
replies.author: Januson

timeline.bodyText:
Same deal as the other version here: the methods are basically identical sans consumer bits.
Also, CPRestrictions should no longer be used -- it doesn't safely work around parameter limits.
timeline.author: Ceiu

timeline.bodyText: Where'd our scope modifiers go in this class?
timeline.author: Ceiu

replies.bodyText: I tried to apply suggestion from JUnit5 to use default visibility and forgot to revert the commit. Modifiers are back now.
replies.author: Januson

timeline.message:
ENT-3286: Manifest delete takes 24 hours or more in large environment (60k consumers in owner)
 - Fix too many params issue in manifest import
 - Replace batch delete of entitlements with batch delete by ids
 - Refactor updatePoolsFromStack to avoid calling deletePools n times

ENT-3286: Manifest delete takes 24 hours or more in large environment (60k consumers in owner)
 - Fix too many params issue in manifest import
 - Replace batch delete of entitlements with batch delete by ids
 - Refactor updatePoolsFromStack to avoid calling deletePools n times

timeline.bodyText: I'm confused. Your comment says "Replace batch delete of entitlements with batch delete by ids", but this is unchanged (it's still deleting by entity)?
timeline.author: nikosmoum

replies.bodyText: That is the issue I mentioned during scrum. With delete by ids I am hitting issues with detached entities. Not sure why that happens so I removed it from PR until it is fixed.
replies.author: Januson

timeline.message:
ENT-3286: Manifest delete takes 24 hours or more in large environment (60k consumers in owner)

 - Fix too many params issue in manifest import
 - Refactor updatePoolsFromStack to avoid calling deletePools n times

timeline.bodyText: If you're going to spend the effort to abstract this out, it should go on Pool itself as a helper method there. Putting this here in CPM to be used exactly once probably isn't that helpful.
timeline.author: Ceiu

timeline.bodyText: This will make debugging a pain. We should keep separate counts and then output the totals when we're done partitioning.
timeline.author: Ceiu

timeline.bodyText: Sorry, I guess I wasn't clear on this last time. I meant moving the output statements to outside the loop rather than a bunch of individual updates that will elongate output and require manual math during debugging.
timeline.author: Ceiu
